For particulars see the other leaf.
Mr. HOLT, whose Performances have been received with great applause, in
Edinburgh, Dublin, and most of the Principal Towns, in the Kingdom, will play
an Air on the rombone with variations, EVERY EVENING During the Week.
Corelli's celebrated Trio, for two Violoncellos and Contra Basso, will also
be repeated EVERY EVENING During the Week.

Which is announced by Drums, Trumpets, and a military Band playing
the National Air of

RULE BRITANNIA!

PART IH.
GRAND BATTLE SYMPHONY,
.
.
Beethoven.
This Grand and effective Work, begins by the Approach of the British
Army, which is announced byDrums, Trumpets, and a military Band playing
the National Air of " Rule Britannia.** Next follows the approach of the French
Army, with Drums, Trumpets, and a military Band playing the French Mr
of " Marlbrook s*en va en Guerre.** The Signal of Battle. The Battle begins;
Here the music imitates the firing of Cannon and Musketry and all t h e
Horrors of a Siege ; A Grand Intrada of Drums and Trumpets announces th^
Victory, and is followed by a Triumphal March, concluding with " GOD SAV r
"

The Nobility, Gentry, and the Public are moat reapM-'full, informed, that this

*

NEW & COSTLY T H E A T R E ,

* * The Work will bo illustrated with numerous cuts on wood, by the carpenters, and a variety of headI and tail Pieces
by the various membtrs of the company. The Artistes. Messrs. CUTHBERT, NICHOLLS, MEADOWS MACFARREN,
and GORDON, have been, for several weeks M M M t j , in taking views, on the spot, where the Scenery is laid (the painting
rooms of the theatre)—and the costume has been prepared by Mr. PALMER and Miss IRELAND, without regard to
expence, after the newest fashions, in the Courrier des Dames and Magasins des Modes, of Europe, Asia, Africa, and
America. The properties (real and personal) by Mr. KELLY, Miss KELLY, and Assistants. The thread ot the story will
be vnrarelled, by the most complicated machinery, under the direction of Mr. MUSGROVE—nnd the whole will be wound
up into completeness, under the superintendence of Mr. H. 1. WALLACK.

Now the most complete and elegant in Europe, will Open lor the Season,

On IHOIVD AY, D e c e m b e r 2 6 , 1 8 4 2 .
f^- The O H E S S C I R C L E is furnished with chairs, and ample space is given to each 9eat.
The F I R S T and S E C O N D T I E R S <»f B O X E S have Humbert*. Seats and Backs, and
the comfort of the Visitors in every respect, has been carefully attended to.
The P I T is spacious, aud the seats have backs, and are covered throughout.
The C r A L L E R Y is larjre and commodious—and
The P R I V A T E B O X E S are unequalled in size and comfort.

The Music selected,arranged, and partly composed by N l . B L E W I T T > ' liH ' M l S « & B E C K E T T The incidental Dances arranged by B E f t d a i l l O V E D Y .

THE LOST LETTER,
Having been received with shouts of laughter and applause, will be repeated
every alternate Evening until farther notice.

LITTLE RED RIDING HOOD.

Having been received with the highest marks of approbation, by a crowded and fashionable

audience, will be repeated in the course of the Week.
In consequence of the overflow to every part of the Theatre, on Thursday Evening last, to witness
the performance of the Opera of

LA

SONNAMBULA,

It will be repeated, with its powerful Cast, on MONDAY next.
